intro: Knautia subcanescens var. cravinae, commonly known as the Cravinae knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, woolly appearance. This variety is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
